decisions.description: Check whether the current Service Territory has a flag "Subcontractor Territory" = true. Only if so, continue with further checks if any Work Order Share records have been created previously.
decisions.name: Decision_IsSubcontractorServiceTerritory
decisions.label: Is Current Service Territory a Subcontractor Territory?

decisions.name: Decision_Public_Group_for_Current_ServiceTerritory_exists
decisions.label: Public Group for Current Territory exists?

decisions.description: If a Grandparent Work Order Id has been looked up with the Get-element successfully, then check if the Record has previously been shared with any subcontractor - if so, revoke access.
decisions.name: Decision_SA_Has_Grandparent_Workorder
decisions.label: Service Appointment has Grandparent Workorder?

decisions.description: If a Grandparent Work Order Id has been looked up with the Get-element successfully, and the user has selected "grant read access to the grandparent work order" in the on-screen dialogue, then create a work order share record in the subsequent path.
decisions.name: Decision_Share_Grandparent_Workorder
decisions.label: Share Grandparent Workorder?

decisions.description: If the Public Group record was successfully looked up in the previous get element, then proceed to create a "Work Order Share" record, otherwise show an error message/dialogue.
decisions.name: Public_Group_Found
decisions.label: Public Group Found?

decisions.description: If the Work Order Share Record looked up in the previous element exists, then delete the record.
decisions.name: Work_Order_Share_Record_Exists
decisions.label: Work Order Share Record Exists?

Flow.description:
09/03/2022 - V1: Initial version created from Requirements in Jira https://watercarestp.atlassian.net/browse/MSRS-309
02/05/2022 - V2: Extended the flow to also update the Service Territory on the Parent Work Order of the Service Appointment triggering this flow as requested in https://watercarestp.atlassian.net/browse/MSRS-226. Added a Get element "Get Service Appointment Parent Work Order" and the update element "Update Service Territory on Parent Work Order".
09/05/2022 - V3: Extended Flow functionality to grant access to a (Grand-)parent Work Order that is related to the Service appointment/work order triggering the flow. See details in https://watercarestp.atlassian.net/browse/MSRS-991

dynamicChoiceSets.description: Used to query all active Service Territories, that have the Flag "Subcontractor Service Territory" set to "true" - in order to present the query result back to the user as a (dynamic) picklist.
dynamicChoiceSets.name: RecordChoiceSet_Get_Subcontractor_ServiceTerritories

Flow.interviewLabel: MSN - Service Appointment - Assign SA to Subcontractor {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}
Flow.label: MSN - Service Appointment - Assign to Subcontractor

recordCreates.description: Create a "Work Order Share" record that grants access to the Grandparent Work Order looked up earlier in this flow (and if the user chose "yes, grant read access to grandparent work order" in the screen element).
recordCreates.name: Create_Work_Order_Share_Record
recordCreates.label: Create Work Order Share Record

recordDeletes.name: Delete_Work_Order_Share_for_Current_Service_Territory_Public_Group
recordDeletes.label: Delete Work Order Share for Current Service Territory Public Group

recordLookups.description: Retrieve the name and subcontractor status of the previously assigned Service Territory. This is used in the subsequent get element to attempt to lookup a Public Group of the same name.
recordLookups.name: Get_Current_Service_Territory_Details
recordLookups.label: Get Current Service Territory Details

recordLookups.description: Retrieve the ParentWorkOrderId from the Parent Work Order related to this Service Appointment in order to determine, if there is also a Grandparent Work Order existent. If so, then this will be shared with the selected Subcontractor Territory later in the process as well.
recordLookups.name: Get_Grandparent_Work_Order_Id
recordLookups.label: Get Grandparent Work Order Id

recordLookups.description: Attempt to retrieve the name of the "Public Group" that has the same name as the previous Service Territory assigned before the user chose a new one. If found, then attempt to find a Work Order Share record for the Granparent Record and if also found, delete it in order to revoke record access.
recordLookups.name: Get_Public_Group_of_Current_Service_Territory
recordLookups.label: Get Public Group of Current Service Territory

recordLookups.description: Attempt to retrieve the name of the "Public Group" that has the same name as the selected Service Territory the user chose on the previous screenelement. If found, then this is used to share record access to the Granparent Work Order in the subsequent create element. Please note: Field Service Lightning automatically Creates Public groups for each Service Territory created. Any users that have dispatching rights in that Service Territory (using "User Territories") will be a member of that public group and hence get access to the record.
recordLookups.name: Get_Public_Group_of_selected_Service_Territory
recordLookups.label: Get Public Group of selected Service Territory

recordLookups.description: Get the ID of the Service Appointments parent Work Order triggering this flow. This will then later be used to also update the Work Orders Service Territory.
recordLookups.name: Get_Service_Appointment_ParentWO
recordLookups.label: Get Service Appointment Parent Work Order

recordLookups.description: Attempt to lookup an existing custom share record for the Grand Parent Record that has been shared with the current Service Territory.
recordLookups.name: Get_Work_Order_Share_Record_for_Current_Public_Group
recordLookups.label: Get Work Order Share Record for Current Public Group

recordUpdates.description: Used to update the "Service Territory" selected by the user in the previous screen also on the Service Appointments Parent Work Order. This was explicitely requested in https://watercarestp.atlassian.net/browse/MSRS-226 in order to ensure, that a Work Order/Service Appointment once given out to a Subcontractor stays with that Subcontractor also when the Subcontractor field crew selects "Cannot Complete".
recordUpdates.name: Update_Service_Territory_on_Parent_Work_Order
recordUpdates.label: Update Service Territory on Parent Work Order

recordUpdates.description: Used to update the "Service Territory" field on the Service Appointment that opened this flow to the Service Territory Id selected by the user in the previous screen.
recordUpdates.name: Update_Service_Territory_on_Service_Appointment
recordUpdates.label: Update Service Territory on Service Appointment

screens.description: Presents the user with a dynamic picklist of all Subcontractor Service Territories which can be used to assign the Service Appointment to.
screens.name: Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor
screens.label: Assign Service Appointment to Subcontractor

fields.name: Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_ServiceTerritory_Heading
fields.fieldText: Which Subcontractor do you want to assign to this job?

fields.name: Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_ShareGrandParent_Heading
fields.fieldText: Allow read access to the parent Work Order?

fields.name: Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_ShareGrandParent_Hint
fields.fieldText: This service appointment and its related work order seem to be a child of a parent Work Order. Do you also want to give the subcontractor read access to the parent record so that they e.g. can see notes, photos, and other details?

fields.name: Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_ShareGrandParent_Checkbox
fields.fieldText: Yes, please grant read access to the parent Work Order

screens.description: Shows an Error Screen, when no public group was found to inform the user that sharing of the Grandparent Record Failed.
screens.name: Screen_Error_No_PublicGroup_Found
screens.label: Error - No Public Group Found

fields.name: Screen_Error_No_PublicGroup_Found_ErrorText
fields.fieldText:
Awww, snap! Could not grant access to the Parent Work Order.


We could not find a Public Group named "{!Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_RadioButtonChoices}" to grant read access to the Parent Work Order.


The Service Territory of the subcontractor has been updated successfully, however, you will need to share record access to the parent Work Order manually.


Please navigate to the Work Order of this Service Appointment, then open the (Grand-)Parent Work Order from the field "Parent Work Order" in the "Details" tab. Then use the button "Share" in the top right quick action bar to share access with the users you require.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: Shows a success message when the user has not chosen to Share record access to the Parent Work Order or no Parent Work Order exists.
screens.name: Screen_Success_NoSharing
screens.label: Screen Success

fields.name: Screen_Success_Text_0
fields.fieldText:
Success!


We updated the Service Territory to the subcontractor {!Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_RadioButtonChoices} successfully!

Should the subcontractor dispatch jobs by themselves, their job coordinator and field crew now have access to the Service Appointment and Work Order.

screens.description: Shows a success message when the user has chosen to Share record access to the Parent Work Order.
screens.name: Screen_Success_With_Record_Sharing
screens.label: Screen Success - With Record Sharing

fields.name: Screen_Success_With_Record_Sharing_Text
fields.fieldText:
Success!


We successfully updated the Service Territory to the subcontractor "{!Screen_Assign_SA_to_Subcontractor_RadioButtonChoices}".

﻿Should the subcontractor dispatch jobs by themselves, their job coordinator and field crew now have access to the Service Appointment, the Work Order, and the Parent Work Order as well.

variables.description: Holds the Record Id of the record this flow was opened from. The Id is handed over automatically when the flow opens from Salesforce.
variables.name: recordId

variables.description: Stores the Id of any preexisting Work Order Share REcords that have been created for the current Service Territory before the user chose a new one.
variables.name: var_Current_PublicGroup_WorkOrderShare_Id

variables.description: Stores the ID of the currently assigned Service Territory. This will be used in the flow to check, whether the ID is a "subcontractor" Service Territory and revoke access to the Grandparent Work Order Record
variables.name: var_Current_ServiceTerritory_Id

variables.description: Stores the information, whether the current Subcontractor Territory is a "Subcontractor" territory.
variables.name: var_Current_ServiceTerritory_Is_Subcontractor

variables.description: Stores the Name of the looked up current Service Territory, before the user selected a new Subcontractor Territory in the Screen Element
variables.name: var_Current_ServiceTerritory_Name

variables.description: Used to look up the Public Group of the previous Service Territory assigned before the user made a change.
variables.name: var_Current_ServiceTerritory_PublicGroup_Id

variables.description: If existent, this variable is used to stores the ID of the Grandparent Work Order related to the Work Order parented to this Service Appointment. This is the used later in the flow to share access rights to the grandparent WO with the selected Subcontractor Service Territory
variables.name: var_GrandparentWorkOrder_Id

variables.description: Stores the Name of the new "Public Group" looked up in the get element. If found, this is then used to create a "Work Order Share" record that gives access to the record to all members of the Public Group.
variables.name: var_New_ServiceTerritory_PublicGroup_Name

variables.description: Used to store additional information about the new Service Territory chosen by the user on the Screen "Assign Service Appointment to Subcontractor"
variables.name: var_New_ServiceTerritory_Record

variables.description: Stores the ID of the Parent Work Order related to the Service Appointment triggering this flow.
variables.name: var_ParentWorkOrder_Id
